      Arima.Simulation build()

      Set the model coefficients to be used in simulating the ARIMA model.

    • Method Detail

      • setCoefficients

        public Arima.Simulation.Builder setCoefficients(Arima.ModelCoefficients coefficients)
        Set the model coefficients to be used in simulating the ARIMA model.
        Parameters:
        coefficients - the model coefficients for the simulation.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setDistribution

        public Arima.Simulation.Builder setDistribution(Distribution distribution)
        Set the probability distribution to draw the ARIMA process random errors from.
        Parameters:
        distribution - the probability distribution to draw the random errors from.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setPeriod

        public Arima.Simulation.Builder setPeriod(TimePeriod period)
        Set the time period between simulated observations. The default is one year for non-seasonal model coefficients and one month for seasonal model coefficients.
        Parameters:
        period - the time period between simulated observations.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setSeasonalCycle

        public Arima.Simulation.Builder setSeasonalCycle(TimePeriod seasonalCycle)
        Set the time cycle at which the seasonal pattern of the simulated time series repeats. This defaults to one year.
        Parameters:
        seasonalCycle - the time cycle at which the seasonal pattern of the simulated time series repeats.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • setN

        public Arima.Simulation.Builder setN(int n)
        Set the number of observations to be simulated.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of observations to simulate.
        Returns:
        this builder.

      • sim

        public TimeSeries sim()
        Simulate the time series directly from this builder. This is equivalent to calling build on this builder, then sim on the returned Simulation object.
        Returns:
        the simulated time series.

      • build

        public Arima.Simulation build()
        Construct and return a new fully built and immutable Simulation object.
        Returns:
        a new fully built and immutable Simulation object.
